column4: Vista may not be honoring that, I don't know if Wubi works well with Vista or not, I've only ever tried it on XP
ubiquity is the Ubuntu installer
hmm, I clicked away the "installin, plz wait" window to look what "extended" would offer, then I clicked "install" again (pII 350) and nothing seems to happen since 15 mins
sorry, what was your question again?
is it possible that clicking away this wait-window is harmful to the install process?
I really don't know what you're asking, I'm trying to follow too many conversations
old chatting-malaise ;}
I'm not sure, are you running ubiquity from a liveCD?
yes I am
what stage is it at?
ready to install
no but I clicked this wait--- away
are you re-sizing partitions?
no, re-partitioning
wiping
then I don't know, sorry, reboot and try again I guess
maybe this 350 mhz calculator is so slow?
that's a possibility too
but I should be seeing some kind of mkext3fs or so in top ;(
at some point, yes
mkext3fs is formatting your drive, if you have a big drive or a slow CPU, it will take a while
